title: Thug broke girlfriend’s ankle after her tarot cards exposed his cheating ways
text:

A thug broke his ex-girlfriend's ankle after she accused him of cheating - because tarot cards exposed his lies, she claims.

Jenna Clemence said she became suspicious that partner Ben Johnston had another woman, and her cards confirmed the worst.

They had been dating for a year when Jenna said the 41-year-old acted "shifty" when he received a late night message.

She consulted her tarot cards and was devastated by what she learned, the Daily Star reports.

The 'wronged' woman, from Blackburn, said she laid the deck in front of her, asking if Johnston had another woman.

And upsettingly for her the first two cards to be turned over where queens.

“I was devastated," she said. "He had two women in his life.”

She said she knew the cards would "reveal the truth" because they "never lie".

Despite thinking the thug was "the one", Jenna said his sister opened up about his cheating ways, revealing he had another long-term girlfriend.

When she visited Johnston in his flat in order to retrieve her nine-year-old son's X-Box, he flew into a rage an attacked Jenna viciously, breaking her ankle.

She said: "He charged at me like a rugby tackle."

“When I suspected Ben of cheating, I knew my tarot cards would reveal the truth.

“The cards never lied.

“I laid out the cards in front of me and asked the question, ‘Does Ben have another woman?’

“I flipped over the first card. It was a queen. Then I turned over the second. It was another queen.

“I was devastated. He had two women in his life.”

Medics confirmed that she had suffered a fracture.

Jenna, who works in a pet shop, met Johnston online in October 2016.

Despite the couple suffering highs and lows Jenna said they stuck together.

She said: “I just really loved him. I was blinded by him, he made me melt."

But one night when she saw a text light up his phone at midnight she became suspicious.

“He told me it was just part of a game he was playing, but the way he was acting told me otherwise, really shifty, she said.

"I thought, ‘You liar’. I lay there all night seething. I just knew it was another woman.”

The next day when Jenna took out her pack of tarot cards she uncovered the truth.

It took more than a year for him to be arrested after a police appeal.

In August he was sentenced to 16 months in prison, suspended for six months.

Jenna said: “I was relieved he was finally out of my life.

“I’m now seeing a lovely new man –and still loving my tarot cards.”
description: Jenna Clemence, from Blackburn, said she became suspicious that partner Ben Johnston had another woman, and her cards confirmed the worst
